description._content: Image Description from historic lecture booklet: "The Rhine has had much to do with the history of Europe. Even in the times of the Romans the Rhine had its important cities and towns. Caesar led his soldiers along its banks; Charlemagne, another great conqueror, fought many battles near it; and Napoleon Bonaparte marched his armies back and forth across it. There is hardly a foot of the Rhine which has not its notable history and every town and castle was pass, if it could speak, might tell an interesting story. § From the Rhine a boat may pass by means of canals into the Danube. The river is internationalized as far as navigable." Original Collection: Visual Instruction Department Lantern Slides Item Number: P217:set 020 015 Restrictions: Permission to use must be obtained from the OSU Archives.
